com.bragi.sonify.composer.riffology

Class TestScenarioTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • junit.framework.Assert
      • junit.framework.TestCase
        • com.bragi.sonify.composer.riffology.TestScenarioTest
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    junit.framework.Test

    public class TestScenarioTest
extends junit.framework.TestCase
    This unit test is home of the tests which are described in chapter 10 of the functional specifications document. (As far as software tests can achieve it).
    Author:
    Jan-Christoph Klie

    • Constructor Detail

        public TestScenarioTest(java.lang.String testName)

    • Method Detail

      • testGeneratingMidi

        public void testGeneratingMidi()
        /TS0010/ Generating MIDI This tests uses every implementation of the AComposer, generates a MIDI file and saves it afterwards. It is then imported with the MidiFileReader class. If the file is invalid MIDI, an InvalidMidiDataException is thrown and the test fails.

      • testPlayingTime

        public void testPlayingTime()
                     throws java.io.IOException,
                            javax.sound.midi.InvalidMidiDataException
        /TS0020/ Playing time The playing time of a sequence has to be at least 30 seconds and at most 10 minutes.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        javax.sound.midi.InvalidMidiDataException

      • testReproducibility

        public void testReproducibility()
                         throws java.io.IOException,
                                javax.sound.midi.InvalidMidiDataException
        /TS0030/ Reproducibility Identic input yields identic output. In this test, a text is sonified twice with the same text and the both results are compared binary. Since the result of sonifiing the same text twice should yield the exact same file, this case is asserted.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        javax.sound.midi.InvalidMidiDataException
